reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nOK, It is Early Access game and so its still work in progress. There are some tech issues in joining a match lobby and Devs are working on it and on keyboard controls and further customization. Now is the game good at basic? I think yes. It has potential to be very good and is even now quite fun and I fear addictive. Its Combat arcade meets RPG Fantasy. A Mortal Kombat or Street Fighter in fiery pits of hell and fighters from fantasy epics meets survival. Its simply a fun multiplayer combat game set in RPG mould. I found it simply fun and addictive. Even at early stage its deeply satisfying. Menu is simple and easy to follow. Graphics is quite good. Its a dog eat dog ruthless world. The environment, the players everyone or everything is your enemy. You don't just have to beat the enemy players in rapid deathmatches or the Bosses that jump in simply to kill all, you have to survive also the hostile environment while trying to stay alive and thats both challenging and fun. There are no friends here or even temporary allies to face bigger enemies. You are on your own all the time and anything that can move will certainly kill you. Between friends this will be a kind of extremely fun vs mode, if you are bored of shooting folks down or sniping them in normal vs games. Have fun guys! I look forward to playing this more in coming days.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

**Edited 9/18/2015

I would like to start this review by commending the Development Team for being extraordinarily involved with the community and quite friendly. I asked a question before purchasing the game and the creator of Skara The Blade Remains, cromlech_, responded in a detailed and helpful manner. He then proceeded to invite me to his friend list and took the time to chat with me about my opinion regarding the game. This Dev team seems to be trying really hard to engage the community, be transparent, and take all of our suggestions to heart, and it's wonderful. For anyone interested in Q&A about the game etc., I recommend asking on the forums about when there will be Dev streams on Twitch. After the Q&A they will also be playing the game, so you can watch live footage straight from the Devs. See the TL;DR at the bottom for a short summary of my review.

Now, for the actual review- which I will likely edit as I play more of the game, play more characters, and as the game evolves:

As you would have likely noted, this game just released in a true Alpha state rather recently(about 3-4 months ago). Currently, since the announcement of true alpha, there has been at least one update a month; the last two updates added a playable tutorial, some new skills, bug fixes, implementation of suggestions by the community such as keybinding etc., This game is still in early Alpha - and I repeat, IT IS EARLY ALPHA. Do not expect a fully fleshed out game yet. The framework is there, and it looks quite promising. It will be free to play in the future, so if you would like to wait until its full release to play, then by all means, please do so. That being said, right now your job if you purchase this game is to test current balance between characters, test maps and game systems, and make suggestions on how to improve the game - because the Devs will listen and almost always respond.

General Gameplay - This game has a ton of potential and will be ludicrously fun once all the features are implemented. Right now there are 3 maps, one for each game mode, with plans for more. Some have lava(fall in it and you die) and levers that activate certain map effects. For example, in one map there's a ring in the center that gives way if you hit the lever and this leads to you, or your enemy, tumbling down into a pit of lava. There's also a huge boss-like monster that arises from within the depths of an arena. Currently this monster is an NPC and will attack every player that comes near it - players get extra points for hitting and killing it. A clever player could just stand back as his/her feeble opponents attempt to battle it..and pick them off as they back away in horror. Alas, you will respawn after perishing..so find solace in that.

There are 3 game modes. Team deathmatch, free for all, and duel. They are fairly self-explanatory. - I will update this section further the more I play, if I notice any notable deviations.

Each character, as you level up, has a set of skills the player can pick. Hold down RT or RB on the gamepad to execute said skills. Shinse has a skill that makes her invisible for a short period of time, and a teleportation ability that switches the player's position with that of his/her target. Also, the devs recently added an ability called, forest wind
date:
basically you can dash forward in a straight line, damaging any opponents in your path. They also added 1 new skill for the other two currently playable characters, which you can unlock through progressing(leveling up). There are plans to add passive skills and more primary skills.

There will be a store where you can buy costumes and weapons with in-game currency as well. These costumes will modify stats.

There will be daily quests/missions, factions, gems to modify stats and more in the future. There are placeholders available for them in game already, but they haven't been implemented yet.

For new players - There is a playable tutorial right after you create your first character. It explains basic attack, movement, and how to utilize your special attacks. You'll also be able to test out your skills at the end of the tutorial against a few AI opponents.

Most of the above systems are fairly barebones at the moment, because, well, it's an early alpha. Once they become more fleshed out, the game will have far more depth. I say that to warn the people expecting some kind of fully fleshed out product, in the hopes that the people purchasing the game will do so knowing that they are helping develop it with their suggestions et al.,

Combat Gameplay - Each character utilizes a string based on heavy/light attacks. I use an Xbox 360 gamepad so this would be RB and RT. I have played Shinse, thus far. She is a quick assassin-like character.  Her attacks feel appropriately light and heavy depending on what combination of attacks utilized, and they also look nice. Each character can also throw projectiles, a limited number, per life using the A button. Blocking is here too, but blocking attacks drains stamina - and you do NOT want your stamina drained or your block broken as you will be brutally punished by the AI or other players. That being said, the AI so far is kind of placeholder - For example, if you stealth as Shinse the AI will just stand there until you appear again. Option access should be the first thing I can do in any game, and barring that, it should be the first thing I can do after I create an account.  At full graphics, the game runs on my computer at an amazing 3 frames per second, so I'm sure you can imagine how frustrating it is to turn the graphics of the game down WHILE IT'S GOING!

Second, and I can't really blame the game on this, there seems to be no one online whatsoever.  The most fun I had with the game for a straight hour was when I got up from it to make a grilled cheese sandwich.  Twice.  I don't think solely online games like this should be released without a lot of advertisement.  The actual gameplay is fine, but even on the lowest graphic settings, my computer simply can't handle the game, despite the fact that the graphics are somewhat comparable to Dynasty Warriors, a game that purposefully uses lower end graphics to have a lot of characters on screen on a time.  What is using up all of this?

The game is kinda fun on its own, but I honestly can't recommend this game to you unless you have friends who are willing to get on at the same time.  And since not everyone has this luxury, there are some people who simply can't play the game with other people.

So, I'm going to start by saying my opinion is based on the game in it's current state and build. In no way am I saying that this is how I'll feel in the future. As it develops there is a chance that I could change my stance on the game. So in saying that let's get into it.

Currently I don't feel I can say this game is very good. There are certainly nice things going for it but not nearly enough. The game has a decent concept, though not the most original around. And it looks nice enough and the only reason to bash it is if you're a graphics wh*re. But that is about where the good stops.

Going back to the graphics, for what they currently are...the game runs terrible. I by no means have a monster PC but it's well enough that I have run nicer looking games on higher settings with less stability issues. It also seems hit or miss if the game will launch successfully on the first go. The combat, which should be the shining star in this game is the exact opposite. It's sluggish, slow and at times unresponsive. They claim you can't just spam click but with how it's currently designed, you very much can and still be successful. Connecting to a game is also a hair pulling task. It starts with not enough players. So most of the time you're stuck playing with bots or a single dude who has no place hosting with their internet and its a lagfest. No problem, you'll just play with your friend you might say. Good luck. There is no way to create a lobby and have your friends join. It's all just dumb luck and chance one of you gets a lobby instead of joining a random person and then they can manage to find your game via random clicking and crossing their fingers. I could type my life story about the faults but instead I'll link to a video I did talking about further issues that game has below. But in closing, I'd suggest staying away from this one until they put a lot more work into it. It wasn't ready for testing at all.

reviewText:
Skara is an early access game and it really shows.

There are three game types at the moment. A duel game mode with 1v1 fights, a free for all, and a team death match.
I've have played all three modes and due to the sparse playerbase I was only able to play with actual players in free for all.
The combat is really simple. There is a light and heavy attack a simple block and dodge system and a few special moves you can activate during gameplay. I personally would love to see some type of counter attack system intruduced as blocking did not seem to be as useful as just dodging an attack.

Now this game is full of problems, I've had the game crash multiple times during my short playtime, but the worst problem with this game is that it is an unplayable mess.
The framerate is beyond awful. Just in the menu I was getting 14fps and during online play I was dropping down to 9fps. The camara tracking in this game needs a lot of work as well as it flips around randomly during play.

Right now I cannot recommend playing this game. I hate to give a game in such an early state a bad review but there is just too much work that needs to be done with this game. If the devs continue work and the game become more stable I would love to revist it. But as of now just stay away.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Feel free to call me a fool but time is money and I've spent enough on this game - and it's free.

My first attempt to play it just threw me into a game without warning. Or I think it was a game. It was against two players, and I was what I think is the spearman type character. I didn't pick that, I just hit play, and after loading it just threw me in. At first, my confusion was met with anger as I became the punching bag of two players, and the lag was so horrific that I could not even learn the controls before the game said I was dead.

I exited and spent a few months ignoring it.

Just recently, I saw it in my library and didn't remember why I stopped playing it. I just remembered that it looked nice. Lo and behold I make an account. And it comes back to me that I never did this before. Cool! I pick a spearman and get on my way.

And then a bot kills me. Well damnit. As I learn the controls, I start killing the bot at least once in between two/three deaths. Then it becamse a sparring match, I kill him, he kills me, I kill him. Then I start getting the upper hand. Soon, I'm killing the bot several times over before he even gets me to half health.

So I start spending the brief period between the bot's death to explore.

And that's when I realize I can't. I don't know what else the game wants me to do. Kill the bot? Make more characters to kill more bots or maybe one player? Why can't I explore? What's the point of this?

If I was desperate for a game, this could be a fun little time killer. But I am not desperate for games. I have plenty, I merely wanted to give this one a shot. And having no explanation isn't the worst. But I can't do anything but kill bots as far as I'm aware. I'll pass.
